description:
HotelTonight makes it remarkably easy to book great hotels at amazing last-minute rates on your mobile device, for tonight, tomorrow and beyond. Our mission is to make people feel more alive by delivering the unexpected and we’re looking for a Strategic Partnerships Manager to help do just that.

WITHIN 1 MONTH YOU WILL:
• Develop strong understanding of HT’s value proposition, available solutions and data sets to have meaningful conversations with prospective partners
• Understand supplier needs and competitive landscape in order to position HT effectively in marketplace
• Become familiar with prospect list of top management companies and hotel chains
• Seek and establish warm introductions with potential partners
WITHIN 3 MONTHS YOU WILL:
• Manage overall pipeline and update internal stakeholders
• Develop marketing materials to effectively showcase our product offering
• Conduct conference calls and in-person meetings with potential partners to understand their needs
• Conduct analysis to determine revenue potential and desired business terms
• Implement creative strategies to overcome objections to achieve desired results
• Negotiate win-win business terms and sign contracts with new partners
• Work with our operations team to develop implementation plan and timelines
WITHIN 12 MONTHS YOU WILL:
• Work cross-functionally with Data & Strategy, Product, Legal, and Finance to resolve issues and identify new solutions
• Work with stakeholders across the company on short and long term strategic projects with the goal of strengthening our hotel marketplace
• Represent HT and meet new partners at industry events
WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR IN YOU:
• 2-4 years of relevant work experience, preferably in a fast growing startup, and/or consulting, finance
• Experience managing sophisticated, multi-faceted partnerships & negotiations
• Proven track record in navigating complex deals, terms, and contracting processes
• Strong ability to collaborate, but also to prioritize and manage yourself autonomously
• Excellent communication, organizational and analytical skills
• A love of networking & fostering new connections
• Ability to travel 25% of the time
